name: 太古の海底
description: 「さぁ、我が子よ。ここに座りなさい。今からする話をよく聞くのだ。海には不思議があふれている。この平和な海岸に打ち寄せる波は、私たちを欺く偽りの招待に過ぎない。無限に続く青い海の底には、私たちの想像を越えた世界が広がっている。太古の海底に揺れる廃墟と化した王国と恐ろしいモンスターたちの世界が」

wikiSkinData.lore: “Kassadin vanished at sea over fifty years ago. Whatever you saw down there—if you did see anything—it can't have been the same man I watched fall into the drink. And if it was… gods help us.”

skins.name: サンゴ礁マルファイト

wikiSkinData.lore: “When I was young, I used to watch our ships sail back to port—but of late can't bring myself to look. For every vessel that docks, another runs aground of coral that was not there before. It's as though even the seabed has turned against us, slowly moving toward some unfathomable end.”

“Perhaps my old mind was deceived by the fury of the storm. Yet as we sank, I glimpsed a field of lights beneath the waves, a thousand eyes of wicked alabaster… they were dark things tearing into the flesh of our crew as if all they ever knew was hunger.”

skins.name: アトランティス フィズ

wikiSkinData.lore: “When I was very young, my grandfather told me stories of Atlantis—of their high temples and great undersea army, and their great General Fizz. Grandfather remembered it as it was, you see, and not the silent mausoleum it has become.”

skins.name: 深海底の主ノーチラス

wikiSkinData.lore: “Never once have I sailed these waves looking for missing divers. Something unnatural lives in the depths, and I fear what it does to these lost souls.”

skins.name: アトランティス シンドラ

wikiSkinData.lore: “The Atlanteans were skilled in magic, we know that much is true. But the extent of their power is truly unfathomable… to this day we cannot know if they persist in some forgotten corner of the world, reanimated by whatever dark thing has taken their once-proud city.”

“I saw her! Where light ceases and one is alone with the cold darkness and the sea, she appeared before me—a wordless, ancient thing, pulsing with an unearthly luster as vicious shapes twisted in the gloom beyond.”

skins.name: 深淵の畏怖スレッシュ

wikiSkinData.lore: “If there really was a kingdom beneath the sea, it must have been destroyed long ago. How else do you explain the revenants that prey upon these shores? How else does that thing—Thresh—exist, trapping our souls in his accursed diving bell?”
